candidate_info.name: Abraham Beverley Walker
candidate_info.background: Abraham Beverley Walker was born in 1851 in New Brunswick. He became Canadaâ€™s first Black lawyer, making significant strides for Afro-Canadians in the legal field. His enrollment at the University of New Brunswick marked him as the first law student of any race at the institution. He was dedicated to advocating for the rights and welfare of Black Canadians during a time of significant racial discrimination.
candidate_info.cultural_context: Walker represents not only the struggles and achievements of Black Canadians but also highlights the challenges faced by Afro-Canadians in New Brunswick's history. His efforts in the legal field paved the way for future generations and underscored the importance of representation in all societal facets.
